ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] Disciplines?
ygData.msgSnippet: You can also buy them in the EC tunnel and the command is Alt-C, I believe. ... http://us.click.yahoo.com/J8kdrA/y20IAA/yQLSAA/VK9olB/TM ...
ygData.messageBody:
You can also buy them in the EC tunnel and the command
is Alt-C, I believe.


--- Chris Talbot <chris@...> wrote:

>
> Yeah. They're bought for 2 cp each in the PoK
> Library. Full melee classes
> get them around 30th level, while hybrids have to
> wait until 51st (my main,
> a ranger, is just about nearing the point where I
> can get his first
> Discipline -- the Resistant Discipline, I believe,
> which is the one warriors
> get at 30th or 31st).
>
> Disciplines have been in the game for some time now.
> Someone who has been in
> the game for a few years could probably shed more
> light on exactly how old
> they are. I've only played since January 2003, and I
> think they might've
> been around at that time.
>
> Once you have the Discipline book, you open it and
> learn the Discipline.
> Each Discipline has certain benefits (Resistant
> bumps up all your
> resistances, for instances). They last for a certain
> amount of time, but you
> can only use them once every X number of hours of
> play. There's a window
> that you can pull up (can't remember the command to
> open it up) that lets
> you activate the Disciplines.
>
> Chris
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Su [mailto:suceress@...]
>
>
> I know they are for melee classes. I think you have
> to buy books from a
> merchant of your class to get disciplines. I think
> there might be AA ones as
> well. I don't play melee class so I don't know.
> Maybe a monk, rogue, or
> warrior could shed some more light.
> Sorry I can't be of more help.
> luv,
> -Su
>
